<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/02/21/samsung-enters-fold-history?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Samsung Enters the Fold of History
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Like the standing taco shell, Samsung’s new Galaxy Fold smartphone has earned its spot in the annals of folded-things-history. After teasing techies with a sneak peek in November, Samsung took yesterday for a little <a href="https://www.cnn.com/business/live-news/samsung-galaxy-s10-launch/index.html" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">chest thumping</a> and phone folding.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">How ’bout some specs</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Galaxy Fold—essentially a <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2019/2/20/18221902/samsung-galaxy-s10-event-live-blog-keynote-foldable-phone-unpacked" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">phone that expands</a> into a tablet—starts at $1,980 (wut) and is set for an April 26th release.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It boasts a 4.6-inch screen when sandwiched in half, but expands to 7.3 inches once opened. Oh, and don’t forget about its two (2) batteries and six (6) cameras.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The phone is also adapted for triple-app multitasking, meaning you can text your date while also looking up the bar where you’re meeting on Google Maps while (most importantly) stalking their Facebook. Finally, the innovation we’ve been waiting for.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">And for all you skeptics out there…</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">We know what you’re thinking: </strong>The smartphone market is saturated.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You might be right-ish, given that Apple is <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/apple-executive-shake-up-readies-it-for-life-after-iphone-11550503767" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">looking beyond the iPhone</a> for revenue sources in the face of lower demand. Plus, estimates show that <a href="http://www.pewglobal.org/2019/02/05/smartphone-ownership-is-growing-rapidly-around-the-world-but-not-always-equally/" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more than 5 billion</a> people around the world have mobile devices (more than half of which are smartphones).</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">But Samsung isn’t flinching. </strong></span><span>CEO DJ Koh said the Galaxy Fold “breaks new ground because it answers skeptics who say everything possible has been done, that the era of smartphone innovations is over, and that the smartphone is a mature technology in a saturated market.”</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out, </strong><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-02-20/samsung-launches-1-980-galaxy-fold-phone-that-turns-into-tablet" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">c/o Bloomberg</a>: “It’s a leap that rivals the category shifts not seen since smartphones took off with a broad audience more than a decade ago.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ While we’re here: </strong>If you’re scared away by the price or you've been burned one too many times by a fitted sheet, Samsung also released <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/samsung-echoes-apples-smartphone-strategy-with-expanded-new-lineup-11550691001?mod=hp_lead_pos6" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">four new varieties</a> of its flagship Galaxy S10 smartphone yesterday, doubling its launch roster from years past.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Samsung%E2%80%99s+new+Galaxy+Fold+smartphone+has+earned+its+spot+in+the+annals+of+folded-things-history&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/02/21/samsung-enters-fold-history&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

</a><span>  </span>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FED
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/02/21/snow-day-remember-jerome-powell?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
It Was a Snow Day to Remember for Jerome Powell
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p dir="ltr" style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Fed chair ate pancakes in bed, expressed genuine surprise that <em>The Price Is Right</em> is still on TV, and released the highly anticipated <a href="https://www.federalreserve.gov/monetarypolicy/fomcminutes20190130.htm" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">minutes</a> from the central bank’s January meeting. <strong id="docs-internal-guid-cb5075ab-7fff-4d3d-c48a-f72b7cefcbd0" style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<p dir="ltr" style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Remember, that meeting was a Project X-style gathering as far as central bank meetings go. The Fed backtracked on its earlier plan to gradually raise interest rates, opting instead for a more “patient” strategy.</p>
<p dir="ltr" style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We learned more about why it came to that decision:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li dir="ltr" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px;list-style-type: disc;">
<span>
</span><span><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Economic worries:</strong> There was potential for a “<a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/02/20/business/economy/fed-interest-rates-minutes.html" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sharper-than-expected</a> slowdown in global economic growth,” especially in China and Europe.</p></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li dir="ltr" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px;list-style-type: disc;">
<span>
</span><span><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Geopolitics:</strong> Brexit and trade wars pose the kinds of risks that make central bankers reach for the nearest fidget spinner.</p></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li dir="ltr" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Markets:</strong></span><span> December was brutal for stocks. The Fed said that investors blamed the bank for “not fully appreciating the tightening of financial conditions,” but that changed following its jubilant January meeting.  </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead:</strong> The Fed aims to <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/02/20/the-fed-just-released-minutes-from-its-market-moving-meeting.html" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">end its balance sheet runoff</a> this year (i.e. stop slimming down its bond portfolio).</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/02/21/can-t-teach-old-dog-new-tricks?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
You Can’t Teach an Old Dog New Tricks
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Or in this case, an itchy-thumbed CEO new social media habits. Elon Musk was at it again, firing off questionable tweets about just <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-02-20/tesla-losing-general-counsel-after-two-months-shares-decline?srnd=premium" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">how many cars</a> Tesla plans to crank out this year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Musk first said Tesla (-1.01%) would make 500,000 cars in 2019. Then he backtracked, confirming he meant the company would be producing cars at an annualized rate of 500K by year-end.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1550683686.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="540" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;" alt=""><br>Elon Musk? Tweeting out material company information? To his 24.8 million followers? You don’t say. The string of tweets felt oddly similar to last summer’s notorious “funding secured” fiasco.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Remember, in settling with the SEC over *that* Twitter misfire, Tesla was ordered to designate a securities lawyer to monitor Musk’s and other high-level execs’ Twitter feeds.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Interesting timing, </strong>given that Tesla announced hours after the tweet that its general counsel, Dane Butswinkas, is <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/tesla-replaces-top-lawyer-after-two-months-11550667601?mod=hp_lead_pos3" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">leaving the company</a> after just two months on the job.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For Tesla, this saga is <em>another</em> instance that shows retention isn't exactly its strong suit. Butswinkas’s exit makes him the 42nd exec to <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-tesla-executives-factbox/factbox-tesla-executive-departures-since-2016-idUSKCN1Q91VK?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">leave the company</a> since 2016.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WORKPLACE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/02/21/believe-stapler?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
I Believe You Have My Stapler?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><iframe class="giphy-embed" src="https://giphy.com/embed/40d1Z4ZkY9Ysg" width="480" height="282" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen"></iframe></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In honor of <em>Office Space</em> celebrating its <a href="https://www.theringer.com/movies/2019/2/19/18228673/office-space-oral-history" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">20th anniversary</a> this week, let’s recap 2019’s hippest workplace trends.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">1. Thank God it’s Thursday</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A financial services company in New Zealand <a href="https://www.4dayweek.co.nz/" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">completed</a> one of the most significant experiments yet of the four-day work week (with monitoring from academic partners).</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">How’d it <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/money/2019/feb/19/four-day-week-trial-study-finds-lower-stress-but-no-cut-in-output" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">turn out</a>?</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">No lost output: </strong></span><span>The firm saw an increase in productivity during the four working days to offset the extra day off.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Thank heavens you’re here, Captain Obvious:</strong></span><span> Employees’ work-life balance scores jumped to 78% from a pre-trial level of 54%.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">2. Let’s take this outside</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The “walk-and-talk” is back in style, <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/when-bosses-call-walking-meetings-some-employees-wish-theyd-take-a-hike-11550594597" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per the WSJ</a>. Popularized by Steve Jobs and <em>The West Wing</em>, chatting with your team during a stroll is intended to spark creativity and get you off your butt for a few minutes.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">3. What would you say...you do here?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A <a href="https://www.vouchercloud.com/resources/office-worker-productivity?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=newsletter_axiosmarkets&stream=business" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Vouchercloud study</a> revealed that the average U.K. office worker is productive for 2 hours and 53 minutes during the work day.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ADVERTISING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/02/21/get-digital?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Let's Get Digital
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This year—and for the first time ever—U.S. digital ad spend is expected to outpace the amount spent on traditional advertising, <a href="https://www.emarketer.com/content/us-digital-ad-spending-will-surpass-traditional-in-2019?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=newsletter_axioslogin&stream=top" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per eMarketer</a>.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Remember: </strong></span><span>Two years ago, U.S. digital ad spend (i.e. desktop, mobile, search, and social media) leapfrogged TV ad spend.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>But since digital began growing like a weed, it’s added </span><span><em>all</em></span><span> of the “traditional” channels (billboards, radio, newspapers, and magazines) to the hit list.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">eMarketer predicts companies will spend close to $130 billion on digital ads this year, topping the $110 billion allocated to traditional ads. And by 2023, digital ads are <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2019/02/20/digital-advertising-surpass-print-tv-first-time-report-says/?utm_term=.836ca1af1496" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">set to capture</a> more than two-thirds of all ad spend.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1550689570.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="540" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup class="sub-text"><em>Via </em><a href="https://www.axios.com/digital-ad-spend-to-surpass-all-traditional-media-spend-this-year-1550616703-9308add3-aaf0-4e9f-b393-b9d7f1be55f2.html" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Axios</em></a></sup></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">And this may come as a surprise, </strong>but for the first time, Google and Facebook’s combined share of digital ads will <a href="https://www.axios.com/digital-ad-spend-to-surpass-all-traditional-media-spend-this-year-1550616703-9308add3-aaf0-4e9f-b393-b9d7f1be55f2.html" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>decrease</em></a> this year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That's because Amazon is crashing the party. Amazon’s ad business is expected to grow more than 50% this year, putting Bezos on track to close the gap with current second-place FB.</p>

History\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLike the standing taco shell, Samsung’s new Galaxy Fold smartphone has earned its spot in the annals of folded-things-history. After teasing techies with a sneak peek in November, Samsung took yesterday for a little \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/business/live-news/samsung-galaxy-s10-launch/index.html\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003echest thumping\u003c/a\u003e and phone folding.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eHow ’bout some specs\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Galaxy Fold—essentially a \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2019/2/20/18221902/samsung-galaxy-s10-event-live-blog-keynote-foldable-phone-unpacked\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ephone that expands\u003c/a\u003e into a tablet—starts at $1,980 (wut) and is set for an April 26th release.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt boasts a 4.6-inch screen when sandwiched in half, but expands to 7.3 inches once opened. Oh, and don’t forget about its two (2) batteries and six (6) cameras.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe phone is also adapted for triple-app multitasking, meaning you can text your date while also looking up the bar where you’re meeting on Google Maps while (most importantly) stalking their Facebook. Finally, the innovation we’ve been waiting for.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eAnd for all you skeptics out there…\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWe know what you’re thinking: \u003c/strong\u003eThe smartphone market is saturated.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYou might be right-ish, given that Apple is \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/apple-executive-shake-up-readies-it-for-life-after-iphone-11550503767\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elooking beyond the iPhone\u003c/a\u003e for revenue sources in the face of lower demand. Plus, estimates show that \u003ca href=\"http://www.pewglobal.org/2019/02/05/smartphone-ownership-is-growing-rapidly-around-the-world-but-not-always-equally/\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emore than 5 billion\u003c/a\u003e people around the world have mobile devices (more than half of which are smartphones).\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBut Samsung isn’t flinching. \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCEO DJ Koh said the Galaxy Fold “breaks new ground because it answers skeptics who say everything possible has been done, that the era of smartphone innovations is over, and that the smartphone is a mature technology in a saturated market.”\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out, \u003c/strong\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-02-20/samsung-launches-1-980-galaxy-fold-phone-that-turns-into-tablet\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ec/o Bloomberg\u003c/a\u003e: “It’s a leap that rivals the category shifts not seen since smartphones took off with a broad audience more than a decade ago.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ While we’re here: \u003c/strong\u003eIf you’re scared away by the price or you've been burned one too many times by a fitted sheet, Samsung also released \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/samsung-echoes-apples-smartphone-strategy-with-expanded-new-lineup-11550691001?mod=hp_lead_pos6\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efour new varieties\u003c/a\u003e of its flagship Galaxy S10 smartphone yesterday, doubling its launch roster from years style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Fed chair ate pancakes in bed, expressed genuine surprise that \u003cem\u003eThe Price Is Right\u003c/em\u003e is still on TV, and released the highly anticipated \u003ca href=\"https://www.federalreserve.gov/monetarypolicy/fomcminutes20190130.htm\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eminutes\u003c/a\u003e from the central bank’s January meeting. \u003cstrong id=\"docs-internal-guid-cb5075ab-7fff-4d3d-c48a-f72b7cefcbd0\" style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp dir=\"ltr\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRemember, that meeting was a Project X-style gathering as far as central bank meetings go. The Fed backtracked on its earlier plan to gradually raise interest rates, opting instead for a more “patient” strategy.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp dir=\"ltr\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe learned more about why it came to that decision:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli dir=\"ltr\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px;list-style-type: disc;\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\r\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cp dir=\"ltr\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEconomic worries:\u003c/strong\u003e There was potential for a “\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/02/20/business/economy/fed-interest-rates-minutes.html\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esharper-than-expected\u003c/a\u003e slowdown in global economic growth,” especially in China and Europe.\u003c/p\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\r\n\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli dir=\"ltr\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px;list-style-type: disc;\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\r\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cp dir=\"ltr\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGeopolitics:\u003c/strong\u003e Brexit and trade wars pose the kinds of risks that make central bankers reach for the nearest fidget spinner.\u003c/p\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\r\n\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli dir=\"ltr\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMarkets:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e December was brutal for stocks. The Fed said that investors blamed the bank for “not fully appreciating the tightening of financial conditions,” but that changed following its jubilant January meeting.  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eend its balance sheet runoff\u003c/a\u003e this year (i.e. stop slimming down its bond style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOr in this case, an itchy-thumbed CEO new social media habits. Elon Musk was at it again, firing off questionable tweets about just \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-02-20/tesla-losing-general-counsel-after-two-months-shares-decline?srnd=premium\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehow many cars\u003c/a\u003e Tesla plans to crank out this year.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMusk first said Tesla (-1.01%) would make 500,000 cars in 2019. Tweeting out material company information? To his 24.8 million followers? You don’t say. The string of tweets felt oddly similar to last summer’s notorious “funding secured” fiasco.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eRemember, in settling with the SEC over *that* Twitter misfire, Tesla was ordered to designate a securities lawyer to monitor Musk’s and other high-level execs’ Twitter feeds.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eInteresting timing, \u003c/strong\u003egiven that Tesla announced hours after the tweet that its general counsel, Dane Butswinkas, is \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/tesla-replaces-top-lawyer-after-two-months-11550667601?mod=hp_lead_pos3\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eleaving the company\u003c/a\u003e after just two months on the job.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor Tesla, this saga is \u003cem\u003eanother\u003c/em\u003e instance that shows retention isn't exactly its strong suit. Thank God it’s Thursday\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA financial services company in New Zealand \u003ca href=\"https://www.4dayweek.co.nz/\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecompleted\u003c/a\u003e one of the most significant experiments yet of the four-day work week (with monitoring from academic partners).\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHow’d it \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/money/2019/feb/19/four-day-week-trial-study-finds-lower-stress-but-no-cut-in-output\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eturn out\u003c/a\u003e?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNo lost output: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe firm saw an increase in productivity during the four working days to offset the extra day off.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThank heavens you’re here, Captain Obvious:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Employees’ work-life balance scores jumped to 78% from a pre-trial level of 54%.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e2.
